unnormalised: **Question:** What are some essential yoga practices for overall well-being?
normalised: **Question:** What are some essential yoga practices for overall well-being?

unnormalised: Namaste! As someone who grew up doing Surya Namaskar with my grandmother in our courtyard in Delhi, I can definitely share some insights on yoga practices for overall well-being.
normalised: Namaste! As someone who grew up doing Surya Namaskar with my grandmother in our courtyard in Delhi, I can definitely share some insights on yoga practices for overall well-being.

unnormalised: First off, Pranayama (breathing exercises) is a game changer. Kapalabhati and Anulom Vilom are my go-to practices for calming my mind and boosting energy levels. Even just 5-10 minutes daily makes a difference.
normalised: First off, Pranayama (breathing exercises) is a game changer. Kapalabhati and Anulom Vilom are my go-to practices for calming my mind and boosting energy levels. Even just five to ten minutes daily makes a difference.

unnormalised: Then, of course, there are the asanas (poses). Trikonasana, Bhujangasana, and Adho Mukha Svanasana are great for flexibility and strength. There are tons of resources online, including YouTube channels from the likes of Baba Ramdev, but consider joining a class at a local yoga studio (like maybe in Bandra, Mumbai!) for proper guidance to avoid injuries. Many studios offer trial sessions – they may be charging around Rs. 500 for a session in a 1000 sq ft studio.
normalised: Then, of course, there are the asanas (poses). Trikonasana, Bhujangasana, and Adho Mukha Svanasana are great for flexibility and strength. There are tons of resources online, including YouTube channels from the likes of Baba Ramdev, but consider joining a class at a local yoga studio (like maybe in Bandra, Mumbai!) for proper guidance to avoid injuries. Many studios offer trial sessions – they may be charging around rupee five hundred for a session in a one thousand square feet studio.

unnormalised: Don’t underestimate the power of meditation. Even if you struggle to sit still, start with guided meditations. Apps like Headspace or Calm are a good starting point.
normalised: Don’t underestimate the power of meditation. Even if you struggle to sit still, start with guided meditations. Apps like Headspace or Calm are a good starting point.

unnormalised: Remember, consistency is key. Aim for at least 3 times a week. And listen to your body! Don't push yourself too hard, especially if you're new to yoga.
normalised: Remember, consistency is key. Aim for at least three times a week. And listen to your body! Don't push yourself too hard, especially if you're new to yoga.

unnormalised: Finally, don’t forget about mindful eating and hydration. Yoga isn't just about poses; it's a holistic lifestyle.
normalised: Finally, don’t forget about mindful eating and hydration. Yoga isn't just about poses; it's a holistic lifestyle.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma at AIIMS emphasized the importance of yoga for stress reduction in a recent seminar. So, give it a try and see how it transforms your life! Good luck!
normalised: Doctor Sharma at A I I M S emphasized the importance of yoga for stress reduction in a recent seminar. So, give it a try and see how it transforms your life! Good luck!
